response:
A: Raymond III, Count of Tripoli was a ruler of the County of Tripoli from 1285 to 1310. He was the son of Bohemond IV and Isabella of Ibelin. Raymond was known for his military prowess and his efforts to expand his territory.

One of Raymond's most significant achievements was his conquest of the city of Tyre in 1289. Tyre was a strategic port city that had been under the control of the Mamluks, a Muslim dynasty. Raymond's victory over the Mamluks allowed him to gain control of the city and its surrounding areas.
